author: lightclient
content: Hey just wanted to share something we've been working on - this is a unified specification of all the EOF EIPs. Should be a much easier format for implementers and those curious about EOF! https://notes.ethereum.org/@ipsilon/eof1-unified-specification

author: yperbasis
content: <@425279588009246720> <@275684146658148352> <@425274498732916736> Re. EIP-4750. IMO "inout" or "signature" is a better name for the new section than "type". To my mind type is more immediately associated with things like uint64 or float or complex.

author: axic3354
content: That's a good point, `signature` sounds like a good alternative.

author: axic3354
content: But then again `signature` could be confused with cryptographic signature üò¶

author: lightclient
content: I have avoided using `signature` in the geth impl because of this

author: gcolvin
content:
<@543900561460822016> 
> for each reachable instruction, data stack height is the same for all possible code paths going through the instruction
> * _(There‚Äôs a pending change proposal for removing this requirement)_
I've lost track.  What PR is this?  This is a very important requirement -- I'm not sure you can even validate code that doesn't meet it.

author: lightclient
content: sorry, this was from a previous validation bullet that was removed and I think that child bullet didn‚Äôt get removed

author: lightclient
content: the stack is still required to be the same for all possible code paths

author: marioevz
content:
hi all, I posted this on ethereum magicians but posting it here too:

I‚Äôm implementing tests for EIP-3860 on the python tests repository, and I‚Äôm having trouble understanding point 4 here: https://github.com/ethereum/EIPs/blob/master/EIPS/eip-3860.md#rules

It seems like the hashing costs for CREATE2 are charged even when the initcode exceeds the max length, which doesn‚Äôt make much sense to me since there should be no hashing performed at all.

Is this the correct behavior or should the hashing costs not be charged in this case?

I‚Äôm currently testing using latest version here: https://github.com/ewasm/go-ethereum/tree/eip-3860

author: lightclient
content:
